profile.name: Sebastian Markbåge
profile.bio: Engineer @Vercel. Crafting fast web experiences. Deep dives into #React & #GoLang internals. Learning in public, occasionally hot takes. NYC.

tweets.content: Seeing a lot of discussion around no-code/low-code platforms. While they won't replace traditional development, they're undeniably empowering a new wave of creators. That's a net positive for innovation. #nocode #lowcode #innovation
Just spent 3 hours debugging a CSS issue only to realize I had a typo in `display: flex;`. My brain is now on a coffee break. Send help (and espresso). #webdev #debugging #developerhumor
My therapist told me to stop dwelling on the past. My code's git blame says otherwise. #developerhumor #git #coding

Diving deep into WebAssembly modules today. The potential for performance-critical client-side operations is truly exciting. Anyone built anything production-grade with it yet? #WebAssembly #wasm #webdev

To that recent thread about developer burnout: It's a real issue. Companies need to focus on sustainable pace, not just output metrics. Our craft requires deep focus, which is easily depleted. #developerlife #burnout #worklifebalance

Had a great sync with the team today. Feels good to be aligning on the next quarter's roadmap. Prioritization is always a beast, but clarity is king. #worklife #softwaredevelopment #productdevelopment

Unpopular opinion: Microservices are great for scaling *teams*, not just *applications*. If your team isn't growing substantially, you're probably adding unnecessary complexity. #softwarearchitecture #microservices #devops
If your developer onboarding process takes more than a week to get to a production deployment, it's broken. Good DX starts day one. #DeveloperExperience #DX #onboarding

Just refactored a function that was 300 lines long into 5 functions, each 20 lines. Now I can finally understand what it *actually* does. Future me thanks past me. #refactoring #cleancode #developerlife

Working on a small CLI tool to manage my dotfiles more efficiently. Currently figuring out how to handle cross-platform symlinks gracefully. Any seasoned shell scripters have tips? #clitools #devtools #dotfiles

Discovered a new open-source library for creating beautiful, accessible color palettes for UI. Huge shoutout to the maintainers! Definitely integrating this into my next project. #opensource #uidesign #webdev

Spent the morning reviewing architecture proposals. Always interesting to see different approaches to the same problem. The devil truly is in the details when you're thinking about long-term maintainability. #softwarearchitecture #career #devlife

AI code generation tools are incredible for boilerplate, but they push the mental model up a layer. We still need to understand the underlying principles, perhaps even more deeply, to effectively prompt and verify. #AI #codeAI #softwaredevelopment
The 'best' tech stack is the one your team knows best and can maintain effectively. Shiny new toys are fun, but sometimes stability and familiarity win. #techstack #pragmatism #softwareengineering

Just finished reading 'Designing Data-Intensive Applications' by Martin Kleppmann. My brain feels both full and expanded. Essential reading for anyone serious about backend systems. Highly recommend! #books #softwareengineering #databases

Reading about the new TC39 proposal for `Array.prototype.group()`. This would be a welcome addition! Far too many times I've written a custom reduce for this. Small wins make a big difference for developer ergonomics. #JavaScript #ECMAScript #webstandards

Just submitted my first small PR to a project I've been using for years. It's just a docs fix, but it feels good to finally give back! Highly recommend contributing, even in a small way. #opensource #community

Experimenting with a Rust backend for a personal project. The compile times are a bit of a shock coming from JS, but the type safety and performance are really compelling. Learning curve is real! #RustLang #backend #learning
